required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Calcium Up-Regulation by Percutaneous Administration of Gene Therapy In Cardiac Disease
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1/2 Trial of the Safety and Efficacy of SRD-001 (AAV1/SERCA2a) in Subjects With Heart Failure With Reduced Ejection Fraction

brief_summary.textblock: It is believed that targeted SERCA2a enzyme replacement in HFrEF patients will correct defective intracellular Ca2+ hemostasis, resulting in improved cardiac contractile function and energetics which will, in turn, translate to improved clinical outcomes. Additionally, it is hypothesized that correcting SERCA2a dysfunction will also improve coronary blood flow through correction of the impaired endothelium-dependent nitric oxide-mediated vasodilatation observed in heart failure.

detailed_description.textblock:
The CUPID-3 Trial is an interventional study of SRD-001, an adeno-associated virus serotype 1 (AAV1) vector expressing the transgene for sarco(endo)plasmic reticulum Ca2+ ATPase 2a isoform (SERCA2a), in anti-AAV1 neutralizing antibody (NAb) negative subjects with ischemic or non-ischemic cardiomyopathy and New York Heart Association (NYHA) class III/IV symptoms of heart failure with reduced ejection fraction (HFrEF).
The Phase 1 trial is an open-label, uncontrolled study investigating one dose of SRD-001 at 3E13 viral genomes (vg) in 3 to 6 subjects.
The Phase 2 is a randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled trial with prospective assignment to a single dose of either SRD-001 at 3E13 vg or placebo in a 1:1 ratio and a total sample size of N=50.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in symptomatic parameters
primary_outcome.description: New York Heart Association classification (I, II, III or IV)

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in symptomatic parameters
primary_outcome.description: Quality of life as assessed by Kansas City Cardiomyopathy Questionnaire: 0-24, very poor to poor; 25-49, poor to fair; 50-74, fair to good; and 75-100, good to excellent

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in physical parameter
Change from baseline in LV function/remodeling
primary_outcome.description: Left ventricular end systolic volume (LVESV) as assessed by echocardiography
HF-related hospitalization, ambulatory worsening heart failure, all-cause death, MCSD and transplant

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects who complete the trial
secondary_outcome.description: Those who complete the trial vs withdraw consent, are lost to follow-up, or withdrawn due to an AE or other reason
Changes in heart failure related medications

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of abnormal laboratory test results
secondary_outcome.description: Hematologic, serum chemistries, NT-proBNP and troponin

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of abnormal physical examination findings
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in physical examination findings

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of abnormal findings from interrogation of implantable cardioverter defibrillator

criteria.textblock:
Main Inclusion Criteria:
- Chronic ischemic or non-ischemic cardiomyopathy
- NYHA class III/IV
- LVEF ≤35%
- Maximal, optimized heart failure therapy; ICD
Main Exclusion Criteria:
- Restrictive cardiomyopathy, hypertrophic cardiomyopathy, acute myocarditis, pericardial disease, amyloidosis, infiltrative cardiomyopathy, uncorrected thyroid disease or discrete left ventricular (LV) aneurysm
- Prior heart transplantation, left ventricular reduction surgery (LVRS), cardiomyoplasty, passive restraint device (e.g., CorCap™ Cardiac Support Device), mechanical circulatory support device (MCSD) or cardiac shunt
- Likely to receive cardiac resynchronization therapy, cardiomyoplasty, LVRS, conventional revascularization procedure or valvular repair in the 6 months following treatment
- Likely need for an immediate heart transplant or MCSD implant due to hemodynamic instability
- Inadequate hepatic and renal function
- Diagnosis of, or treatment for, any cancer within the last 5 years except for basal cell carcinoma or carcinomas in situ where surgical excision was considered curative
